Partition data across a cluster.

Source: R/shard.R
partition.Rd

Partition data across a cluster.

partition(.data, ..., .cluster = get_default_cluster())

Arguments

.data, data

Dataset to partition
...

Variables to partition by. Will generally work best when you have many more groups than workers. If omitted, will randomly partition rows across workers.
.cluster

Cluster to use.

Examples

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:testthat’:
#> 
#>     matches
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
cl <- new_cluster(2)

mtcars2 <- partition(mtcars, .cluster = cl)
mtcars2 %>% mutate(cyl2 = 2 * cyl)
#> Source: party_df [32 x 12]
#> Shards: 2 [16--16 rows]
#> 
#> # Description: party_df
#>     mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb  cyl2
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.62  16.5     0     1     4     4    12
#> 2  21.4     6  258    110  3.08  3.22  19.4     1     0     3     1    12
#> 3  18.7     8  360    175  3.15  3.44  17.0     0     0     3     2    16
#> 4  18.1     6  225    105  2.76  3.46  20.2     1     0     3     1    12
#> 5  24.4     4  147.    62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2     8
#> 6  22.8     4  141.    95  3.92  3.15  22.9     1     0     4     2     8
#> # … with 26 more rows
mtcars2 %>% filter(vs == 1)
#> Source: party_df [14 x 11]
#> Shards: 2 [5--9 rows]
#> 
#> # Description: party_df
#>     mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  21.4     6 258     110  3.08  3.22  19.4     1     0     3     1
#> 2  18.1     6 225     105  2.76  3.46  20.2     1     0     3     1
#> 3  24.4     4 147.     62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2
#> 4  22.8     4 141.     95  3.92  3.15  22.9     1     0     4     2
#> 5  17.8     6 168.    123  3.92  3.44  18.9     1     0     4     4
#> 6  32.4     4  78.7    66  4.08  2.2   19.5     1     1     4     1
#> # … with 8 more rows
mtcars2 %>% group_by(cyl) %>% summarise(n())
#> Source: party_df [3 x 2]
#> Shards: 2 [3--3 rows]
#> 
#> # Description: party_df
#>     cyl `n()`
#>   <dbl> <int>
#> 1     4     6
#> 2     6     4
#> 3     8     6
#> 4     4     5
#> 5     6     3
#> 6     8     8
mtcars2 %>% select(-cyl)
#> Source: party_df [32 x 10]
#> Shards: 2 [16--16 rows]
#> 
#> # Description: party_df
#>     mpg  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1  21    160    110  3.9   2.62  16.5     0     1     4     4
#> 2  21.4  258    110  3.08  3.22  19.4     1     0     3     1
#> 3  18.7  360    175  3.15  3.44  17.0     0     0     3     2
#> 4  18.1  225    105  2.76  3.46  20.2     1     0     3     1
#> 5  24.4  147.    62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2
#> 6  22.8  141.    95  3.92  3.15  22.9     1     0     4     2
#> # … with 26 more rows
